pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:0.2: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:0.5: 10. The training rule on exchanging what belongs to an individual
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.2: At that time the nun Thullanandā was a learned reciter, and she was confident and skilled at giving teachings.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.4: Just then the precincts of Thullanandā’s dwelling were falling apart.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.7: and she replied, “I have neither a donor, nor a worker.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.8: Then, after collecting voluntary contributions for the precincts of Thullanandā’s dwelling, the people gave the collected requisites to Thullanandā.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.9: But even though she had asked for them, Thullanandā exchanged those requisites for tonics, which she then used.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.10: When the people found out about this, they complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.11: “When personal requisites are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nun Thullanandā exchange them for something else?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.12: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.15: “… When personal requisites are designated for a specific purpose and were asked for, how could the nun Thullanandā exchange them for something else?
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.16: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.17: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:1.18.1: ‘When a personal requisite is designated for a specific purpose and was asked for, if a nun exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.4: The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.5: A requisite is designated for a specific purpose:
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.6: it was given for a specific purpose.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.8: belonging to an individual nun, not to the Sangha, not to a group.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.10: that she herself had asked for.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.12: if, apart from the purpose for which it was given, she exchanges it for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.13: When she obtains it, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.14: It is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.15: “And, monks, it’s to be relinquished like this.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.16: (To be expanded as in Nuns’ Relinquishment 1, [](pli-tv-bi-vb-np1:2.1.21--2.1.43), with appropriate substitutions.)
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.17: ‘Venerables, this thing, which I got in exchange for a personal requisite that was designated for a specific purpose and had been asked for, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ …
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.21.1: If it is for a specific purpose and she perceives that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.22: If it is for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.23: If it is for a specific purpose, but she does not perceive that it is, and she exchanges it for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.24: When she receives in return what had been relinquished, it is to be used in accordance with the intention of the donors.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.25: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she perceives that it is, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.26: If it is not for a specific purpose, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.27: If it is not for a specific purpose, and she does not perceive that it is, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.29: if she makes use of the remainder;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.30: if she makes use of it after getting permission from the owners;
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.33: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-np10:2.34: The tenth training rule is finished.
